item.title: what is the best software for animation?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Err, no. Ink-and-paint and Flash are types of 2D animation.

Ink-and-paint is exactly what it sounds like: Ink and paint. You make hand drawings and turn them into a cartoon. Like this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BBgghnQF6E4

Flash, on the other hand, is a computer format that takes colored shapes to create the animation. Like this: https://www.homestarrunner.com/sbemail136.html

I don’t know what you want to do.

Read full topic
item.source: what is the best software for animation?

item.title: what is the best software for animation?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Idi: I just bought that book (I’m getting into 3D computer animation). It’s splendiferous!

As for 2D animation, there are a couple fields such as ink-and-paint and Flash, each with different workflows; it depends on what you want to do. But, like Idi said, that book is a must for any animator.

Read full topic
